meanings.definition: A sudden quick movement towards something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The child made a rush towards the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The football fans made a rush towards the field after the game.
meanings.sent3: In her excitement, she made a rush towards the stage to see her favorite singer.
meanings.sent4: The rush of students towards the exit at the end of the school day was like a stampede.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rush of water down the hill was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A feeling of urgency or excitement.
meanings.sent1: She felt a rush of joy when she saw her family after a long time.
meanings.sent2: The rush of adrenaline before a roller coaster ride is thrilling.
meanings.sent3: The rush of getting ready for a surprise party was exhilarating.
meanings.sent4: The rush of emotions during a wedding ceremony is unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The rush of happiness when she received good news was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or with great haste.
meanings.sent1: The students rush to finish their homework before the bell rings.
meanings.sent2: I rush to catch the bus every morning.
meanings.sent3: He will rush to the store before it closes to buy some milk.
meanings.sent4: The workers rush to complete the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: She will rush to the airport to catch her flight on time.

meanings.definition: To push or force one's way through a crowd.
meanings.sent1: The crowd rushed towards the stage to get a better view of the concert.
meanings.sent2: She had to rush through the crowd to reach the lost child.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rush through the crowd to catch the last train.
meanings.sent4: The fans rushed through the gates to enter the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The protesters rushed through the streets to make their voices heard.

meanings.definition: A plant with slender stems and small flowers.
meanings.sent1: The rush by the pond added a touch of green to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: She picked a few rushes to make a simple bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The rush swayed gently in the breeze by the riverbank.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with rushes of different colors.
meanings.sent5: The rush added a delicate beauty to the garden.
